p: This model was designed using a directional vector to replace exons 10â€“13, which codify the serine protease domain of the TMPRSS2 gene. It was constructed by electroporation of embryonic stem cells and their subsequent injection into C57BL/6 blastocysts for at least five generations ( 82). After experimental infection with SARS-CoV-2, TMPRSS2-deficient mouse strains showed reduced body weight loss and viral kinetics in the lungs. Absence of TMPRSS2 affected the infection sites and virus spread within the respiratory tract; therefore, this is a useful model for COVID-19 research ( 73).
